subject: Dancing
event:
Snowing like hell in Santa Fe today.  I feel like Jon Snow on the Wall.  White everywhere I look, and still coming down.

Of course, I'm writing about Meereen, where the weather is hot and muggy, oppressive.  If the snow keeps falling, I better take it as an omen, switch to a Jon chapter tomorrow.

The good news:  finished a chapter today.

The bad news:  it's one I've finished at least four times before.  

This time, though, I think I finally got it right.  We'll see.  Still whacking at the Meereenese knot.  

I took an especially vigorous hack two days ago, by switching to a new POV.  It seems to have helped.  Helps to have a pair of eyes on the inside rather than the outside here.  And back story works better in recollections than in dialogue.  

Let's hope that when next week comes, I still like what I did this week.

Writing, writing...

comments.article: I wish I felt like Jon Snow. Why doesn't it snow in Texas!

Believe me, feeling like Jon Snow is not something to long for..
http://www.thesun.co.uk/scotsol/homepage/news/2796101/62-north-11east-and-34Celsius-it-is-Roros-in-Norway.html
comments.subject: Feeling like Jon Snow..

comments.article: Ii hope this chapter will be more final than the last four times you've finished it :) But if it isn't, that just means it will keep improving and improving
I hope it is improving and improving.  There are dark days when I think I am just chasing my own tail.
Yay Writing!

Write your ass off, man!

You're so close I can taste it!
comments.subject: GO GO GO

comments.article: what can you taste? the writing or the ass? :p
comments.subject: Re: GO GO GO

comments.article: Awesome news.  Godspeed, Sir.

comments.upictitle: bojojoti: Q-GRRM-Winter is Coming by iconsbycurtan
comments.article:
I love the character of Jon Snow, so I'm rooting for the white stuff!

I'm glad you've finished a tricky chapter. And I hope the playoff games won't incline you to treat some of my favorite characters less than charitably. :)
I would rather be in Meereen. Snow is very overrated. I'd take the black if it were in Meereen and not the North.
WOOT! Keep it up George! Always love hearing about Dance progress.

I dont know if you read the comments of your livejournal but i must say your books are the best i read in my life and i could not pass up the chance to tell you you're a genius and my favorite writer.
Since I read a song of fire and ice for the first time, I can not read another book of fantasy. Your work is excellent. Congratulations.

A fan who can not even speak English but he expects that if you read your comments understand something.

Oh, the glamour of being a Famous Author. ^-^

"One word at a time, man. One word at a time."


re: tailchasing. Dude. Your stuff is consistently awesome and decidedly un-tail-chase-y. That's just the mid-novel ennui talking. We, your very own Holy Zombie Horde, have faith in you. =)

Keep plugging,

yr. fan,
j.

I used to live in Albuquerque. The 2 years I was there, it snowed only once.

Omen indeed.

I listened to some audio of Feast for Crows the other night, when I needed a fix of good writing.  I had forgotten just what a grandmaster of the writing craft you really are.  Whatever you decide will be spectacular.

Yay for finishing a chapter. Look to the good and not the bad!

If it's any consolation we are having uncommonly warm weather here in Dunedin. It's stinking hot and I long for air conditioning :(
I know it's insensitive of me, but thank God the Football season is over for most of us.  Writing is good, any writing is good. ;)

"A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away."

~Antoine de Saint Exupéry

I think the same could be said for writing :)

ps. I know some people are impatient but I really appreciate all the time you're putting into making the story just right!

comments.upictitle: Saithkar - Minister For Apocalyptic Affairs: Grim
comments.article: Perhaps you could send some of that snow up to Vancouver where I hear they're running short of the stuff. Not a good look for the Winter Olympics that, having to truck in snow from other places....

Focus on the good news, another chapter done (and hopefully with more finality this time).
Best of luck with that Meereenese knot!
and speaking of snow, try living in Canada.
comments.subject: Great

comments.article: I'm iced in at home in Oklahoma, and that news just made my day!! Go George go! Slay the nasty knot!!
comments.subject: AWESOME NEWS!

comments.article: Whack, whack, whack!  It's always good to hear you feeling optimistic.  The snow in Albuquerque felt quite puzzling, too.  I just stayed in to avoid crazy drivers.

Hey George,

Glad to here that you have finished a chapter, even if you have finished it a hundred times before. Perfection is always in the distance. Also I would suggest that if you are still having trouble with the knot, find "Needle" laying around somewhere and stick it with the pointy end.:)

Keep your pencil sharp, I forsee a break in the know soon.LOL
comments.subject: Meereenese knot

comments.article: Sometimes it's just nice to hear that you're plugging away at it.
comments.subject: Thanks for giving us updates

comments.article:
I know you hear a lot of $#!+ regarding how long it's taking to finish this book, but I'm glad that you are taking the time to make sure everything is exactly how you want it. Whenever it is ready I'll be there to buy it and read it.

John
comments.subject: It'll be ready when it's ready...

comments.article: Ugh, I know the pain of the re-re-rewrite well. Good luck!

It is snowing in Indiana too...
tis also around zero.
Happy writing.

Snow in Santa Fe? I would take it as an omen, but that may just be my Canadian perspective. I feel like Jon Snow everyday waiting at the bus stop in my parka.

Good luck on feeding those threads out of the knot. Hopefully the knot doesn't resemble Ouroboros.
